result.execSummary:
The defendant Christina L David was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Christina L David in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Substitution of counsel filed by Atty. Penkitz. Plea of not guilty entered. Bail to continue.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christina L David in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant completed form to have court appointed counsel. Court will appoint counsel for defendant.
